result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Michael Baribeau

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Notice not sent. Incorrect Court Official's Zoom info. was included. RJG
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:27 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Andrew Michael Baribeau appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Andrew Michael Baribeau.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF322 (PTC), 22CF396 (ARGN), 22CF505 (ARGN).  On both 22CF396 & 22CF505- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Waives speedy trial. DE can appear by zoom for next hearing. Adjourned at 4:29 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:02 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Andrew Michael Baribeau in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Andrew Michael Baribeau.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF322 (PTC), 22CF396 (PH), & 22CF505 (PH).  Court calls 22CF396 for PH- S/T of Officer Nathaniel Behnke of NRPD.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Cross by Atty Dobbe.  ADA Ellenwood requests court to take Judicial Notice of bond in 22CF322.  Court takes Judicial Notice for purposes of today's hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court calls 22CF505 for PH- S/T of Officer Nicholas Baribeau of NRPD.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Cross by Atty Dobbe.  Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. Recross by Atty Dobbe.  ADA Ellenwood requests the Court take Judicial Notice of the bonds in 22CF322 & 22CF396.  Court takes Judicial Notice of bonds in both cases. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE and Atty can appear by zoom for next hearing if pleading NG.  ADA Ellenwood makes statements regarding no contact with victim. Court maintains bond in form and amount.  Adjourned at 4:23 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

4:10 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo for Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Michael Baribeau in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Andrew Michael Baribeau. Includes 22CF322, 22CF396, & 22CF505.  On 22CF505- Judicial transfer, Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court schedules PH on 2 newest files. Court modifies bond to include all 3 cases. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Atty Dobbe makes request for bond modification.  Court notes victim has completed programing.  ADA Ballo states he doesn't believe victim has been properly notified of today's hearing.  Court orders State to reach out to victim first before court will modify bond to NAC.  Court maintains NC at this time. Adjourned at 4:18 PM. bph
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

- AMENDED 

- Includes 22CF322, 22CF396, & 22CF505

- Bond on file in cases 22CF396 & 22CF322

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alexis B or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
for Discovery and Inspection and Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Dobbe. km
Filed by Atty Dobbe. km

Adjustment Number: 22A 055829,
Payable Number: 241951,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

04:20 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, DA: Karl Anderson for ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Matthew Dobbe, DF: Andrew Michael Baribeau appeared.  Includes 22CF322 (ARGN) & 22CF396 (STC).  Court reviews files.  On 22CF322-   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Waives speedy trial.  DA Anderson state discovery and an offer has been sent on 22CF322.  DE needs to secure retainer then Atty Dobbe will file NOR on 22CF396.   DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:26 PM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
By Jacquelyn J - 22R 008365. jaf
SJN to SRN on record 6/15/22. kma
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alexis B or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.


If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:10 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad and Intern Ali Casey, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Andrew Michael Baribeau appeared from jail. Atty. Harrelson has the understanding that DE did not wish to speak with him. DE states that he did not qualify for public defender less than one month ago, Atty. Dobbe represents him on underlying cases and will be representing him on this case as well. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. Atty. Harrelson makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Court administratively transfers to Branch 3. Court sets STC. Adjourned: 1:17 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
